speaker: MULDER
line: My name is Fox Mulder. Since my childhood, I have been obsessed by a controversial global phenomenon. Next, a head shot of a young Samantha; a photo of 12 year-old MULDER dressed in a Star Trek outfit standing next to his sister, her left arm around his shoulder; and finally a blurry photo of 4 aliens, their outlines silhouetted behind a white screen

speaker: MULDER
line: Since my sister disappeared when I was 12 years old, in what I believe was an alien abduction.

speaker: MULDER
line: My obsession took me to the FBI, where I investigated paranormal science cases through the auspices of a unit known as the X-Files. Through this unit I could continue my work on the alien phenomenon, and the search for my missing sister. Next, a photo of MULDER and SCULLY standing together outside in the rain from "The Pilot". Then SCULLY in scrubs as she performs an autopsy, MULDER watching on. Another shot of MULDER and SCULLY working a case, followed by SCULLY's FBI ID and badge. A shot of MULDER lying gravely ill in a hospital bed, SCULLY at his bedside holding his hand with her head on his chest. A shot of MULDER and SCULLY outside at night, guns drawn. MULDER kneeling, holding a stricken SCULLY in his arms. Finally, a recent photo of MULDER and SCULLY embracing, his chin on her forehead

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1993, the FBI sought to impugn my work, bringing in a scientist and medical doctor to debunk it, which only deepened my obsession for the better part of a decade, during which time that agent, Dana Scully, had her own faith tested. We see the stack of photos start to smoulder, smoke rising towards the camera.

speaker: MULDER
line: In 2002, in a change of direction and policy, the FBI closed the X-Files, and our investigation ceased. The smouldering photos suddenly burst into flames. The topmost photo of MULDER and SCULLY starts to bubble and curl as it is engulfed in the fire.

speaker: MULDER
line: But my personal obsession did not. We cut to amateur footage of 3 black helicopters flying low over a 2-storey building and metal roadbridge in pursuit of a flying saucer. Amateur footage taken whilst driving along a highway showing a triangular spaceship flying over the countryside. Ancient rock paintings showing primitive drawings of alien visitations. A Biblical painting showing a flying saucer hovering atop a mountain, rays of light emanating from its underside illuminating an individual on the ground. Finally, footage taken from a high-rise office block window, several storeys up, showing 4 spaceships flying in formation over a large city.

speaker: MULDER
line: There are 10,000 sightings each year in North America alone, and so it's been since the dawn of time. Stone Age and even biblical references, into our modern age. Black and white footage of a small single-seater plane flying over a snow-capped mountain range. Video taken from inside the cockpit showing 9 spacecraft flying in close formation. The front page of the Roswell Daily Record newspaper from Tuesday, July 8, 1947, with headline "RAAF Captures Flying Saucer On Ranch in Roswell Region" and subtitles "No Details of Flying Disk Are Revealed" and "Roswell Hardware Man and Wife Report Disk Seen". The front page of the Roswell Daily Record from Wednesday, July 9, 1947, with headline "Gen. Ramey Empties Roswell Saucer" and subtitles "Sheriff Wilcox Takes Leading Role in Excitement Over Report 'Saucer' Found", "Send First Roswell Wire Photos from Record Office" and "Ramey Says Excitement Is Not Justified. General Ramey Says Disk Is Weather Balloon".

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1947, Kenneth Arnold saw nine unidentified craft out the window of his small plane, followed by the historic crash at Roswell and its legendary cover-up. Grainy black and white nighttime footage of 15 or more small white craft flying in close formation behind the Capitol. Footage from inside the United Nations chamber, the United States representative holding a 2-foot wide flat disk

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1957, UFOs were spotted over our nation's capital. The Pentagon held press briefings. Amateur colour footage taken from the ground showing formations of 4 and 3 fighter aircraft pursuing 3 bright white flying saucers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Multiple witnesses in 1967 at Malmstrom Air Force Base in Montana see fighters scramble but easily outrun by UFOs that climb upwards of 200,000 feet - twice the service ceiling of our highest-flying spy planes. Footage of astronaut Edgar Mitchell getting into his spacesuit with the help of a NASA technician. Mitchell descending the steps of the lunar lander onto the surface of the moon. Grainy footage of a supposed alien autopsy. News footage of Cyrus Vance and Gerald Ford. News releases and printed statements from Congressman Gerald R. Ford, House Republican Leader, stating "anxious to see a congressional investigation of UFO's", and that a secret subcommittee had held hearings in 1961 about the subject.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Edgar Mitchell, the sixth man to walk on the Moon, cites secret studies on extraterrestrial materials and bodies. Secretary of State Cyrus Vance and future president Gerald R. Ford validate the UFO phenomenon in official government memoranda. A flying saucer drops below the cloud layer into a rough and mountainous area of New Mexico, smoke pouring from as it descends in a tight arc before slamming hard into the earth and skimming along the ground, churning up the surface and damaging the craft.

speaker: MULDER
line: But now people only laugh, and only Roswell is remembered. A closeup camera shot panning around the crashed craft. The upper surface mostly intact from the crash whilst smoke billows from the wreckage.

speaker: MULDER
line: But we must ask ourselves: are they really a hoax? Are we truly alone? We see an alien hand touching a blackened window from the inside of the craft. A survivor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or are we being lied to? A lot of exposition to start the new mini-series, bringing new viewers up to speed and reminding us old viewers of what drew us to the series back in the 1990's. As the opening credits roll we are greeted with an almost-original version from the first season, albeit with the welcome addition of Mitch Pileggi as Skinner. THE TRUTH IS OUT THERE

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Can I ask how much longer?

speaker: MAN IN BLACK
line: Two shakes of a lamb's tail, Doc. The bus suddenly hits a divot as it leaves the blacktop. The DOCTOR looks apprehensive about what is to come. The bus rolls to a stop in front of a low wire fence on a level area of ground. The door opens. The DOCTOR is first off the bus, holding a large black medical bag and his cap under his right arm. He straightens up and stops, staring into the distance. The MAN IN BLACK, tall and angular, joins him at his side, unperturbed. He puts on his black fedora and quickly sizes up the unsure DOCTOR.

speaker: MAN IN BLACK
line: Step quick. The MAN IN BLACK walks off. Over their heads we see the wreckage of the crashed spacecraft in the distance. A military truck and a couple of Jeeps are already parked at the site. A dozen or so armed soldiers are milling around the site and guarding its perimeter. Smoke is still billowing from the wreckage. The DOCTOR follows the MAN IN BLACK slowly down a dirt track towards the crash site. We see a large chunk of the craft was broken off during the impact. Men are digging in the ground around the craft with shovels. Floodlights have been erected to let work continue into the night. The DOCTOR and the MAN IN BLACK finally reach the doomed spacecraft and stand together in front of it, awestruck.

speaker: NURSE
line: Excuse me. Dr. Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: NURSE
line: You have a phone call.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just heading into surgery. More surgeons pass behind the NURSE and enter the operating theatre

speaker: NURSE
line: That's what I told him, but... but he said it was important.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who is it?

speaker: NURSE
line: He says his name is Walter Skinner. Assistant Director, FBI. The NURSE leaves and she follows the surgeons into the operating theatre. As the camera pans back around to the redhead, we finally see SCULLY's face properly for the first time. She turns slowly and stares long into the distance. It must have been a long time since she's heard that name.

speaker: JIMMY KIMMEL
line: If I was the president, the moment I was inaugurated, my hand would still be hot from touching the Bible, and I would immediately race to wherever they hold... have the files about Area 51 and UFOs, and I'd go through everything to find out what happened.

speaker: BARACK OBAMA
line: The aliens won't let it happen! The camera pulls back further. We hear a cellphone vibrate. We see MULDER sitting in front of the laptop as he picks up his phone and answers it.

speaker: MULDER
line: My life's become a punch line. What's happening out there, Scully? Out of surgery, SCULLY is standing in the observation room still in her scrubs

speaker: SCULLY
line: A.D. Skinner's looking for you. We see more of MULDER's office. A lot of things that we might remember from his basement office. Filing cabinets against the wall. The orange pencils have been tidied up into a tin on the desk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why doesn't he just call me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He doesn't know how to reach you, Mulder. I barely know how myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does he want, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He wants to know if you've been watching someone called Tad O'Malley on the 'net. Apparently he's reached out to us from the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold on. I'm bringing him up. MULDER searches for the name and a new video starts playing on the mindquad website. We see a smartly-dressed talk-show host, TAD O'MALLEY, sitting behind a desk. A video of the burning World Trade Center is playing behind him as he talks to the camera.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: It comes down to this. It's a mainstream liberal media lying to you about life, liberty and your God-given right to bear firearms. We can safely say that MULDER's first impression is not favourable.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would I watch this jackass, Scully?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: 9/11 was a false flag operation. It was a warm-up to World War III. Now, hear me on this. It's all part of a conspiracy dating back to the UFO crash at Roswell...

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought you were done with UFOs. The stranglehold they put on your very existence, I believe is how you put it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just the messenger, Mulder. Apparently this guy is desperate to meet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell Skinner to set it up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Seriously?

speaker: MULDER
line: And don't pretend I'm going alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uber?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hitchhiked. Relax, Scully. I'm kidding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just worry about you, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not to worry, Doc. I'm taking good care of myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's good for you to get out of that little house every once in a while.

speaker: MULDER
line: It certainly was good for you. SCULLY takes a moment before smiling back at MULDER wryly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm always happy to see you.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I'm always happy to find a reason. They share a moment and smile at each other. A black stretch limousine pulls up alongside the kerb, interrupting the moment. MULDER and SCULLY look at each other. The driver and O'MALLEY get out. The driver stands by the car whilst O'MALLEY approaches Moose and Squirrel.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Fox Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. O'MALLEY extends a hand as he heads towards MULDER. They shake.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Tad O'Malley. He turns to SCULLY.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: And you must be former agent Dana Scully. O'MALLEY shakes SCULLY's hand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. That's... quite an entrance you make there.

speaker: MULDER
line: She shot men with less provocation.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Funny. I heard you were funny. Join me for a little ride?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd be happy to talk to you, Mr. O'Malley, but right here is fine.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Allow me my small precautions. Low-flying aircraft often employ what they call "dirtboxes" to record conversations that I prefer private. MULDER looks skyward

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aircraft employed by whom?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I'm afraid I can only speculate. Shall we? MULDER ponders, hanging back with SCULLY as O'MALLEY gets back in the car. SCULLY gives MULDER a look before following O'MALLEY to the car. MULDER follows moments later. Inside the limousine O'MALLEY retrieves a bottle of Louis Montreuil champagne chilling on ice and presents it to his guests.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Because... why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: None for me, thanks. Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I take it you have enemies.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Well, not always of my choosing, Dana. MULDER tries the lower the window. The switch does nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Air's getting a little hot in here.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Oh, I'm sorry... those don't roll down. I had the vehicle bulletproofed.

speaker: MULDER
line: 'Cause you never know when a gun-toting liberal might go Hinckley. SCULLY tries to steer the conversation back on track whilst the men continue to size each other up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You'll have to excuse him. How can we help you, Mr. O'Malley?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I'm not some Johnny-come-lately to the UFO phenomenon, Mr. Mulder. Like yourself, I'm a true believer.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I only want to believe. Actual proof has been strangely hard to come by.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You ran the X-Files. You were the X-Files. You all but wrote the book.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm afraid that book is closed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As are the X-Files. For better or worse, we've... moved on with our lives. MULDER turns to look at SCULLY.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, we have. For better or for worse. SCULLY's eyes turn towards MULDER, but she doesn't make eye contact with him. Clearly some tension there.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Well that's beside the point.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is the point, Mr. O'Malley? And how does a man with your conservative credentials count himself a believer in UFOs and 9/11 false flag conspiracies?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I take it you think my message is disingenuous?

speaker: MULDER
line: Conspiracy sells... it pays for bulletproof limousines.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You think I do it for the ratings?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you're The O'Reilly Factor with a shopworn little gimmick.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: What Bill O'Reilly knows about the truth could fill an eyedropper. MULDER smiles at this, clearly surprised. He shares the look with SCULLY, before directing the conversation to test O'MALLEY's knowledge on the subject.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Kelly Cahill incident. O'MALLEY looks confidently back at MULDER

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Kelly Cahill and her husband were driving home in Victoria, Australia, when a craft appeared overhead. The Cahills lost an hour of time, and Kelly was hospitalized with severe stomach pain after discovering a triangle-shaped mark near her navel.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: As I said... my interest is real. What I need is your expertise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Our expertise for what?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I'm rattling some pretty big cages in the intelligence community, but I'm prepared to go all in - prepared to blow open maybe the most evil conspiracy the world has ever known.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's quite an assertion, Mr. O'Malley. What's stopping you?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: If I'm putting my ass out there, I need to know it's hanging by more than just a very slender thread. MULDER turns to SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently, he has something to show us.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Something... and someone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aliens couldn't find this place. How did you, Mr. O'Malley?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: A man in my position finds himself contacted by interesting strangers. Inside the house someone notices the threesome approaching the door and puts on a lightweight long cardigan, before heading to the door and opening it.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Everyone, meet Sveta. The door opens and we see SVETA, a beautiful brunette with long hair falling around her face.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Sveta, this is Dana Scully and Fox Mulder. SVETA smiles and shakes the hands of MULDER and SCULLY

speaker: SVETA
line: Hi.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: SVETA
line: Hello. Welcome to my home.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Sveta's who suggested I call you.

speaker: MULDER
line: And how would you know to do that?

speaker: SVETA
line: You probably don't recognize me. MULDER smiles at SVETA

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think I'd remember.

speaker: SVETA
line: You interviewed me and my family when I was just a little girl. Right after my first abduction. Please, come in. MULDER looks away slightly, trying to remember the meeting. They enter the house. Standing in front of them, SVETA pulls up her top to expose her abdomen. We see 6 belly-button-sized deep circular scars around her navel.

speaker: SVETA
line: These are from over 20 years. MULDER and SCULLY are seated at opposite ends of a 3-seater sofa. O'MALLEY has a chair.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You both probably recognize the classic scoop-mark scars.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How many times have you been abducted, Sveta?

speaker: SVETA
line: I lost count. And then there are the screen memories they implant.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: The memories implanted over actual memories to make abductees forget.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm familiar with the syndrome.

speaker: SVETA
line: They aren't always effective, and things come back to me sometimes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like what kind of things?

speaker: SVETA
line: Tests they do. Harvesting and stuff. We see close-up flash images of a foetus and SVETA lying on her back in considerable pain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The aliens made you pregnant? SVETA looks at O'MALLEY. He nods slowly.

speaker: SVETA
line: A number of times. But they take the babies before they're born. Those are the memories they can't remove.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They removed your unborn fetuses?

speaker: SVETA
line: Through here. They do everything through here. Even with the DNA. SVETA points to her navel and the half-dozen scars on her abdomen.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Tell them about your DNA, Sveta.

speaker: SVETA
line: I have alien DNA. For sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you had a doctor confirm that?

speaker: SVETA
line: No. MULDER nods to himself before turning to SCULLY.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something you could test? Dana? SCULLY stares back at MULDER.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Oh, Lord. Oh, good Lord.

speaker: MAN IN BLACK
line: Damn thing could be dangerous. The MAN IN BLACK takes a handgun out of his jacket and fires twice at the alien.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: What are you doing?! Suddenly the armed soldiers all open fire and unload multiple rounds into the alien's body.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: For God's sake! What have you done?! The alien lies facedown and motionless on the ground, it's body riddled with bullet holes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm gonna take a swab. If you'll roll up your sleeve I'll get some blood, too. SVETA rolls up her left sleeve.

speaker: SVETA
line: I know you're doubtful about this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you say that, Sveta?

speaker: SVETA
line: I'm kind of a mind reader.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that a personal trait, or is that what happens with alien DNA?

speaker: SVETA
line: I can move things. With my mind. SCULLY wants proof to back up such a claim.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you care to demonstrate?

speaker: SVETA
line: I can't do it all the time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So it just... happens whenever.

speaker: SVETA
line: I don't know how to control it.

speaker: SVETA
line: You were a couple before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, what?

speaker: SVETA
line: You and Mr. Mulder. You were together, but now you're not. SCULLY's demeanour suddenly changes, from that of someone taking SVETA's claims with a pinch of salt to someone quite uncomfortable about what she might find out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You reading my mind, Sveta?

speaker: SVETA
line: He's been depressed. What you diagnosed as endogenous depression. It's what killed your relationship. And you have a child together. SCULLY jabs the needle into SVETA's arm with more than degree of extra force than is necessary. SVETA winces.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's enough.

speaker: SVETA
line: Do you believe me now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't you tell me.

speaker: SVETA
line: You don't know what it's like to be abducted. To be taken against your will. You don't know. SCULLY moves closer to SVETA and stares directly into her eyes for a few seconds.

speaker: SVETA
line: Well... maybe you do.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was right about one thing. Conspiracy's made you a very rich man.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: One way to look at it. What's made me rich is my pursuit of the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: My pursuit's not been so lucrative. As they near the helicopter O'MALLEY stops. MULDER takes another step before turning back to him.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I feel I need to warn you. When we arrive at our destination, the people we're meeting are very paranoid about the work they do.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I want to prepare you for what you're about to see, Mr. Mulder. They stop in the doorway. O'MALLEY removes the black hood from MULDER's head, who takes a moment to adjust his eyes before scanning the inside of the warehouse.

speaker: MULDER
line: A Faraday cage? For what?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Do you know what an ARV is?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what you brought me here to see? The scientist, a middle-aged Japanese man with greying hair, reaches them as they enter the building.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: This is Garner. He'll walk you through the science. GARNER turns and leads the two men towards the Faraday cage at the other end of the warehouse.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's an alien replica vehicle?

speaker: GARNER
line: Given your background, I would've thought you'd seen one before.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, never. Not like that.

speaker: GARNER
line: What we're showing you we do at great risk. Colleagues have had labs burned to the ground and work destroyed by our own government. We see an overhead shot of the Faraday cage containing the ARV. 6 scientists in blue lab coats are in the enclosure. The triangular ARV's upper surface is covered with many small rectangular panels. Its three cockpit windows are orange-gold. One of the scientists opens a gate for GARNER, MULDER and O'MALLEY to enter. MULDER approaches the craft with eager anticipation and touches a panel on the leading edge near to the nose. He looks like a kid in a candy store for the first time. The craft slowly powers up and smoothly rises off the ground, almost silently. Its landing legs retract and the craft rises to a height of a few metres, where it hovers. MULDER has to let go as it rises up just out of reach.

speaker: GARNER
line: It's running on toroidal energy - so-called zero-point energy. Simply the energy of the universe.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're talking about free energy?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: That we've had since the '40s.

speaker: GARNER
line: No fuel, no flame, no combustion. A simple electromagnetic field. Technology kept secret for 70 years while the world ran on petroleum.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oil companies making trillions.

speaker: GARNER
line: What I'm gonna show you next is the most unbelievable part. GARNER motions to one of the other scientists. The craft's surface shimmers and flickers and disappears in a matter of seconds, leaving MULDER, O'MALLEY, GARNER and the other scientists moving around in an apparently-empty Faraday cage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gravity warp drive but... how?

speaker: GARNER
line: Element 115. Ununpentium.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you get it?

speaker: MAN IN BLACK
line: Where are you going with that thing? Clearly more determined, the DOCTOR answers back over his shoulder as he walks past.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm a man of medicine, sir.

speaker: MAN IN BLACK
line: It's dead. It's done now. The DOCTOR stops and turns back towards the MAN IN BLACK.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Then why even bring me out here? He turns away and continues towards the waiting truck with the alien body in his arms.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Testing yourself for alien DNA?

speaker: SCULLY
line: High cholesterol.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Sorry to barge in on you like this. It looks like you've had quite a day. SCULLY has blood spatter to the front and left of her neck. Her scrubs seem fresh. They walk through to the adjoining monitoring room that SCULLY seems to consider a second home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The usual around here. O'MALLEY walk in and looks up at the monitors suspended from the ceiling in the room. X-rays, a photo and details of Lucas Moore - another patient - are on the displays.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Doesn't look so usual to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a disease called microtia. Children born without ears.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You operate on these kids?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assist the surgeons, who are really doing God's work. Giving kids what their biology neglected.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: So it's a genetic deformity?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly, but not conclusively. It's most common in Navajo Indians.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: What's so striking is how alien it looks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assure you that is simply a random coincidence, Mr. O'Malley.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You mean, unrelated to your previous work experience?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Far, far from that experience.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Do you miss it at all? The X-Files?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As a scientist, it was probably some of the most intense and challenging work I've ever done. I've never felt so alive.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: You mean working with Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly one of the most intense and challenging relationships I may ever have. And quite honestly, the most impossible.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Yeah. I got that impression.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you here for a reason?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I needed to know you weren't upset by Mulder putting you on the spot with this Sveta business.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it's fine. I'm... used to it.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: And I just wanted to see you again.

speaker: SVETA
line: How did you get here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hitchhiked. Inside the farmhouse a little later. MULDER and SVETA are sitting at the dining table. On a side table we see framed black and white photos of her grandparents, and a larger photo of SVETA as a young infant being held by her mother.

speaker: MULDER
line: There was a moment you were being asked about your abductions... about your pregnancies, how the aliens took your babies and before you answered, you looked at O'Malley. Why?

speaker: SVETA
line: Because it's not exactly the right question.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, I don't understand.

speaker: SVETA
line: Because I don't believe it's aliens who were taking them.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you said you were abducted. SVETA's eyes start to well up. She is clearly finding it difficult to talk about her experiences.

speaker: SVETA
line: This is difficult. These are very difficult memories, and this is... very dangerous answers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, everything stays between us, Sveta.

speaker: SVETA
line: The things I've experienced... they've affected my entire life. They've made it impossible to have anything like a normal existence.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you afraid of?

speaker: SVETA
line: That it only gets worse. MULDER nods in understanding.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sveta, who took your babies?

speaker: SVETA
line: Men.

speaker: MULDER
line: Men? Humans? You saw their faces? SVETA's voice starts to break. Her eyes more tearful. She takes a deep breath.

speaker: SVETA
line: Yes. They took me aboard their ships, and...I was afraid they would kill me if I ever told anyone the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's why you... didn't see a doctor...

speaker: SVETA
line: Who can I trust? They would call me a liar when they're the liars.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can trust me.

speaker: SVETA
line: You worked for the government.

speaker: MULDER
line: Technically, but not for years. SVETA's eyes are wide, focused intently on MULDER.

speaker: SVETA
line: But you always wondered... if they weren't lying to you too. MULDER looks at her in silence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, listen to me. I've been misled. We've been misled.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, hold on a second.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, just... just listen to what I'm saying. What if everything we've been led to believe in is a lie? What if there is no alien conspiracy? SCULLY leans toward O'MALLEY who is sitting in the backseat with her. He's removed his tie and the neck of his shirt is unbuttoned. She hands him her glass of champagne to hold.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can we pull over a second? I've got to get out. The limousine pulls over to the kerb. SCULLY steps out of the car onto a well lit street in Washington, D.C.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm talking about everything we've been led to believe. Our work, the X-Files, everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can we talk about this soon?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know why O'Malley came to us, Scully. . And that girl is the key, Scully. Sveta is the key to everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Couldn't you be jumping to conclusions?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't do this over the phone right now, Scully. I got to go. MULDER is standing outside the farmhouse with SVETA.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where are you going? Mulder? Talk to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are they... the files?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know where they are.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said no one had been down here - it hadn't been touched.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not for 14 years since you and Scully left the Bureau.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need access to the X-Files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you tell me what this is about?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's about controlling the past to control the future. It's about fiction masquerading as fact. Now, you owe me some answers, Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You just calm the hell down, Mulder, before we both get pissed off. I don't take orders from you.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Who do you take orders from?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why do you think I called you? Because I was looking out for you - like I've always looked out for you. MULDER starts to get angry.

speaker: MULDER
line: A decade of my life in this office. He lashes out. He manages to rip the I Want to Believe poster into two pieces whilst kicking the fallen ceiling tile it is lying on top of.

speaker: MULDER
line: And all the time, I was being led by my nose through a dark alley to a dead end, exactly as they planned.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're blaming me for that? Now MULDER is getting angry with himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm blaming myself. I'm sure they lied to you, too.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There hasn't been a day since you left that I haven't reached for my phone to call you, Mulder, wishing that you were still down here. Since 9/11, this country has taken a big turn in a very strange direction.

speaker: MULDER
line: How they police us and spy on us, tell us that makes us safer? We've never been in more danger. SKINNER takes a few steps closer to MULDER and offers up a challenge.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then do something about it, Mulder. MULDER takes out his cellphone and dials a number in his contacts list before heading for the door. SKINNER's cellphone rings straight away. MULDER stops in the doorway as SKINNER takes his phone out of his pocket and looks at it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now you've got my number. MULDER walks off down the corridor, leaving SKINNER standing alone in the X-Files office.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: So if you own a registered firearm, you will actually be targeted as an enemy by your own government in the likely imposition of martial law. He turns to another camera and gets up out of his chair, walking around to the front of his desk.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: But I'd like to end the show on a brighter note by pointing out the heroic work being done by a friend of mine. Literally putting kids back together who are born without something we all take for granted. At Our Lady of Sorrows Hospital in Washington, D.C., Dr. Dana Scully - working to mend the lives of unfortunate children.

speaker: NURSE
line: Dr. Scully? I've got your test results back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Nurse? I need you to do something.

speaker: NURSE
line: Of course. SCULLY marks up the test report with a pen

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need these samples retested.

speaker: NURSE
line: Was there a problem with them? A surgeon in scrubs calls to SCULLY from the corridor before entering the operating theatre.

speaker: SURGEON
line: Dr. Scully? We need you in here. SCULLY smiles to the NURSE

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just want them retested, please. Thank you. Oh... and I'm expecting a call... well, I'm hoping for a call... from somebody named Mulder.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Is the hour absolutely necessary?

speaker: MULDER
line: It was important that I see you.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We made an agreement about our meeting in unsecured environments.

speaker: MULDER
line: I took the usual precautions. I'm assuming you did too? They both look up as they suddenly hear an aircraft flying directly overhead. We see the plane's lights against the night sky. They keep watching until it's no longer close, then resume their clandestine conversation.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been standing here for over an hour. I haven't seen a soul. I called you because you said, if I ever put the pieces together, that you would confirm.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: And have you put them together?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've met someone. I've seen something.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Because you weren't even close. Warring aliens lighting each other on fire and other such nonsense.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was being cleverly manipulated.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: And what brings this new clarity?

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw an ARV, running on free energy. I saw it disappear.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: That's what they all seem to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: But the technology exists. It's existed since Roswell. And it's been in use, being used on humans in human testing, the taking of men, women and children that's misreported as alien abductions.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: So you believe you have the "how".

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. And I think I know the "why".

speaker: DOCTOR
line: The "why" is more complicated than you may ever know, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: 60 years ago we were warned about the military industrial complex gathering too much power.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: This is old news.

speaker: MULDER
line: The countdown has begun. It began in 2012 but no one knew.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Tell me something new.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alien technology being used against us. Not by aliens, not with aliens, but by a venal conspiracy of men against humanity.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You're wasting my time.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are the tests for?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You tell me, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ten years ago, you came to me, saying you couldn't take your secrets to your grave, that you couldn't live with it. We see flashbacks of the young DOCTOR present at abductions whilst medical procedures are being carried out.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm a man of medicine. I didn't know how my work would be used. The lies are so great, Mr. Mulder. The truth must be unassailable.

speaker: MULDER
line: So let me tell the world.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: They'll make a mockery of us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then let me take that bullet.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: And these men are capable of that. You're nearly there. You're close. The DOCTOR starts to walk away, but stops and turns back towards MULDER. He pauses for several seconds.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Roswell. That was a smokescreen. The DOCTOR turns and walks away

speaker: MULDER
line: So I've been told. MULDER turns and walks off in the other direction.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing here, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you hang up on me, I don't hear from you all day. You're on some jag about the X-Files...

speaker: MULDER
line: I figured it out. It all makes complete sense. All these years we've been deceived.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what you mean.

speaker: MULDER
line: I... I couldn't call you because it's gonna sound crazy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's why I'm here, Mulder, as somebody who cares about you. As somebody who's worried about you.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right just listen to me, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you listen to me, Mulder. MULDER takes SCULLY by the shoulders

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you got to trust me on this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have seen this before. You're on fire, believing that you're onto some truth, that you can save the world.

speaker: MULDER
line: This will finally be their undoing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It'll be your undoing, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is my life. This is everything. This is everything I believe in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want to believe. You so badly want to believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do believe. I believe that Tad O'Malley is right. This is not an alien conspiracy. It's a conspiracy of men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tad O'Malley is a charming man full of charming B.S., Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, he woke me up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know he's not playing you? He's a player.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's been a godsend.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: The truth is out there Scully, and Tad O'Malley's gonna broadcast it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... listen to me. As your friend, and as a physician, you are on dangerous ground here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know what I'm doing. Suddenly we hear SVETA's voice through the screen door.

speaker: SVETA
line: Is everything... okay? We see SVETA standing inside MULDER's house. SVETA looks at SCULLY. SCULLY's mind starts to run the numbers. This isn't going to end well.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, everything is okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's the key to everything. Sveta... is the key. SCULLY's manner changes from one of concern for MULDER's wellbeing to one of disillusionment. She looks crushed, her mind having raced ahead to the wrong conclusion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know what you're doing. SCULLY turns and slowly heads down the porch steps. MULDER knows what she's thinking. He rolls up his sleeves and tries in vain to call her back to explain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... SCULLY ignores him and walks back to her SUV, parked a short distance away on soft grass. She probably regrets not wearing flats. She gets into the SUV and sits in the driver's seat, staring back up at the house.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Hey. Where you going? You're not leaving are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just need to get out of here.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Stay. It's important.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't tell me what's important, please. I just need to leave. MULDER approaches SCULLY's car. O'MALLEY turns to him.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Wasn't she invited?

speaker: MULDER
line: I would have invited you, Scully, but I didn't think you'd come.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I shouldn't have come.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Then what are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you up to? Later inside MULDER's house. SCULLY and O'MALLEY are sitting on a sofa in his living room. SVETA in a dining chair. SCULLY's arms are firmly crossed across her chest. MULDER stands as he delivers his theory.

speaker: MULDER
line: The tentacles reach far back into the last century, but it wasn't until victories in Europe and Japan and the onset of the Cold War that political and economic conditions became perfect for actual execution. MULDER sits down in a vacant dining chair.

speaker: MULDER
line: A conspiracy bigger and more secret than the Manhattan Project.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: More odious and far-reaching.

speaker: MULDER
line: No sooner had we defeated Germany than a new threat started appearing in skies over America, drawn to Earth by the latest threat to extinction - the H-bomb. Explosions acting as transducers, drawing alien life forms through wormholes in spaceships using electro-gravitic propulsion. Advanced extraterrestrial species visiting us, concerned for mankind and the threat of our self-destruction, forestalling our annihilation through their own self-sacrifice. The crashes at Roswell. More importantly, places like Aztec. World leaders signed secret memos directing scientific studies of alien technology and biochemistry. Classified studies were done at military installations, S4, Groom Lake, Wright Patterson and Dulce - extracting alien tissue. Tests were done on unsuspecting human subjects in elaborately staged abductions, in craft using alien technology recovered from the downed saucers... including human hybridisation through gene editing and forced implantation of alien embryos.

speaker: SVETA
line: Why do such a thing and lie about it? Our own government?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your own government lies as a matter of course, as a matter of policy. The Tuskegee experiments on black men in the '30s, Henrietta Lacks...

speaker: SVETA
line: What are they trying to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the missing piece.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: But it's not hard to imagine... a government hiding, hoarding... alien technology for 70 years, at the expense of human life and the future of the planet. O'MALLEY now stands, ready to continue detailing the theory to SVETA and SCULLY.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: Driven not only by corporate greed, but... a darker objective.

speaker: MULDER
line: The takeover of America.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: And then the world itself - by any means necessary, however violent... or cruel... or efficient. By severe drought brought on by weather wars conducted secretly using aerial contaminants and high-altitude electromagnetic waves. In a state of perpetual war to create problem-reaction-solution scenarios to distract, enrage and enslave American citizens at home with tools like the Patriot Act and the National Defense Authorization Act, which abridged the Constitution in the name of national security. The militarization of police forces in cities across the U.S. The building of prison camps by the Federal Emergency Management Agency with no stated purpose. The corporate takeover of food and agriculture, pharmaceuticals and health care, even the military, in clandestine agendas, to fatten, dull, sicken and control a populace already consumed by consumerism.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: A government that taps your phone, collects your data and monitors your whereabouts - with impunity. A government preparing to use that data against you when it strikes, and the final takeover begins. MULDER sits in his chair, nodding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The takeover of America?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: By a well-oiled and well-armed multinational group of elites that will cull, kill and subjugate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Happening as we sit here?

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: It's happening all around us.

speaker: MULDER
line: The other shoe waiting to drop.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: It'll probably start on a Friday. The banks will announce a security action necessitating their computers to go offline all weekend.

speaker: MULDER
line: Digital money will disappear.

speaker: SVETA
line: They can just steal your money?

speaker: MULDER
line: Followed by the detonation of strategic electromagnetic pulse bombs to knock out major grids.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: What will seem like an attack on America, by terrorists or Russia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or a simulated alien invasion using alien replica vehicles that exist and are already in use.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An alien invasion of the U.S.?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Russians tried it in '47. SCULLY shakes her head slowly

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can't say these things.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I'm gonna say them tomorrow. SCULLY picks up her jacket and stands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's fearmongering claptrap, isolationist techno-paranoia so bogus and dangerous and stupid that it borders on treason. Saying these things would be incredibly irresponsible.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's irresponsible not to say it.

speaker: SVETA
line: Especially if it's the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your test came back negative.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, negative?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She has no evidence of alien DNA. The disappointment is clear on MULDER's face. SVETA looks shocked and confused.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: I promised you the truth today, but that truth has come under assault. Cut to SVETA at an undisclosed location, talking to numerous reporters with microphones and recorders.

speaker: SVETA
line: Tad O'Malley tried to put words in my mouth. He paid me to create stories about alien abductions. He is saying lies and stories for his TV show so people will watch. I am so sorry if I misled anyone. MULDER is also watching the video stream. As he is watching we see that the video of SVETA's admission is playing on the large screen behind O'MALLEY in the Truth Squad studio.

speaker: MULDER
line: They got to her. MULDER slams his laptop shut in frustration.

speaker: O'MALLEY
line: These are the depths our government stoops to. We must be making them very afraid. Cut back to the hospital. The NURSE appears in the doorway holding the new test results.

speaker: NURSE
line: Dr. Scully? Your test results came back in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sveta? Sveta? Not finding her in the house, he opens the back door and heads into the garden.

speaker: MULDER
line: SVETA? There's clean washing on the line, but no sign of SVETA.

speaker: GARNER
line: No! No! No! The vehicles come to a screeching halt. Several armed soldiers get out, training their weapons on the scientists.

speaker: GARNER
line: Stop! You can't! You have no right... One of the soldiers punches GARNER in the face, knocking him to the ground. Other soldiers enter the Faraday cage and place magnetic explosives on the ARV. Just as swiftly as the explosives are set the soldiers head back to their vehicles and speed out of the warehouse. As the vehicles speed out of the warehouse's doorway the charges explode, destroying the ARV and engulfing the helpless scientists in a huge fireball.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's something called the Venus Syndrome. It's a runaway global warming scenario that leads us to the brink of the Sixth Extinction. Those with means will prepare to move off the planet into space, which has already been weaponized against the poor, huddled masses of humanity that haven't been exterminated by the über-violent fascist elites. If you believe in that kind of thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You look exhausted, Mulder. MULDER looks tired. SCULLY looks tired too, but there's something else too. Her voice is weaker than usual.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was a long day at the office...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know if you saw, but... Tad O'Malley pulled the plug.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're very good, these guys, you know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what about Sveta? Where is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure they scared her to death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need to find her, Mulder. We need to protect her, no matter what.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? You said her tests came back negative.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I ran them again. In fact... I sequenced her entire genome because I didn't trust the initial results.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you saying she has alien DNA?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And I sequenced my own genome... because of my history and... because we have a child together.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... what are you saying?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm saying she's not the only one. I'm saying someone has to stop these sons of bitches. SCULLY's cellphone suddenly bleeps as it receives a text message. MULDER's cellphone bleeps at almost the same time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Skinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner. Skinner Situation critical. Need to see you both ASAP.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, are you ready for this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know there's a choice. MULDER nods gently.

speaker: SVETA
line: Oh, no... The car cuts out. She presses the accelerator repeatedly but gets no response.

speaker: SVETA
line: Please! Please don't quit. No! The car rolls to a gentle halt in the middle of the road. She tries to restart it. The car remains dead. Suddenly a bright green shaft of light penetrates the car from above, entering through the sunroof. SVETA looks up in horror and awe through the glass in the roof. We see the shaft of light is coming from a bright circular feature on the underside of a triangular-shaped spaceship hovering overhead, similar to the ARV we saw earlier in the warehouse. SVETA cries out in horror

speaker: SVETA
line: Oh, no. No! The spaceship slowly descends until it is only about 25m above SVETA's car. The beam of green light suddenly stops. The car is now illuminated brightly in white light. SVETA fights to get out of her seatbelt and open the car door. She cries out as she panics.

speaker: SVETA
line: No! Finally, SVETA manages to open the door and starts to get out, but it is too late. The car explodes in a huge fireball, a mushroom cloud of smoke rising into the night sky. The spacecraft slowly and silently rises up into the sky and out of view, leaving burning wreckage scattered across the road.

speaker: CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN
line: Yes. Yes. I see. He closes the call and puts the phone down. An assistant walks over to him holding a lit cigarette. The CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN looks up at him.

speaker: CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN
line: We have a small problem. The assistant places the end of the cigarette in the tracheostomy tube. The CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN inhales deeply. The cigarette burns brightly.

speaker: CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN
line: They've reopened the X-Files. He exhales slowly through his tracheostomy tube, staring into the fire. Fade to black. It's been a while since I last updated - please let me know if you like the new transcript!
